Class ElevatorCommandCenter

java.lang.Object
ElevatorCommandCenter
public class ElevatorCommandCenter extends Object
The Elevator command center controls the entire elevator system in the building. It manages the elevators, the requests and utilizes multithreading.
Author:
Arthur Kaplan

  • Method Details

    • addRequest

      public void addRequest(Request request) throws ElevatorException
      Adds a request to the list of Requests.
      Parameters:
      request - the request to be added
      Throws:
      ElevatorException - the elevator exception which is thrown when the request cannot be added.

    • start

      public void start()
      This method calls the processRequests() method for as long as there are unfulfilled requests in the request list.
      Processing of requests starts after 1 second to ensure that the while loop is not exited before the request list can be filled. It also has an inbuilt delay between each request.

    • processRequests

      public void processRequests()
      Processes requests in a new Thread. Depending on the request's starting floor, a different message is displayed on the command line. After a request is completed, the elevator is no longer in use and can fulfill another request.

    • printMsgCurrentFloorIsNotZero

      private void printMsgCurrentFloorIsNotZero(Elevator elevator)
      This message is printed to the command line if the current floor if anything other than the ground floor.
      Parameters:
      elevator - required to get the elevator's current floor, destination, and direction

    • printMsgCurrentFloorIsZero

      private void printMsgCurrentFloorIsZero(Elevator elevator)
      This message is printed to the command line if the elevator is currently on the ground floor.
      Parameters:
      elevator - required to get the elevator's current floor, destination, and direction

    • printMsgRequestIsComplete

      private void printMsgRequestIsComplete(Elevator elevator)
      This message is printed when a request has been completed, i.e. when the elevator reaches its destination.
      Parameters:
      elevator - required to get the elevator's number and current floor
